question: Does the light source power on with battery?
details: Power on the device with battery. Examine whether light bulb gives sufficient illumination.

question: Recharge battery if applicable or replace it.
details: Refer BTA skill set on Batteries to identify and replace damaged batteries.

question: Replace bulb if necessary.
details: Refer BTA skill set on Lighting/Indicators to replace non-functional light bulbs.

question: Inspect and fix broken wires or bad connections between the battery and bulb.
details: Inspect wires and connections from battery to bulb using multimeter. Refer BTA skill set on Connections for identifying and fixing broken wires and bad connections.

question: Does the device use a fiber optic cable and still the light source doesn’t power on with battery?
details:
There are two types of otoscopes:
• Conventional otoscope
• Fiber optic otoscope
If the bulb still doesn’t power on then there might be cracks in the fiber optic strands. So the unit might have to be replaced.

question: Inspect for cracks in fiber optic strands and replace the unit if necessary.
details: If the illumination is not sufficient then inspect for cracks in fiber optic strands.

question: Is the lens free from cracks/defects?
details: Any defect in the eyepiece lens obstructs vision of ear canal.

question: Replace lens if necessary.
details: Identify and replace with a suitable lens.

question: Is the head and handle connected properly?
details: Improper connection between head and handle may result in faulty operation of the device.

question: Refer device manual to assemble the parts.
details: Follow instructions in the device manual to assemble the parts together.

question: Block the tip of speculum with finger.
details: This test is performed to detect any air leaks in the device. Connect the pressure bulb to the connector in otoscope to perform this test.

question: Is the device free from air leaks?
details: If the flow of air due to pressure is not felt at the tip of speculum then there is a possible air leak in the device.

question: Apply pressure with insufflator bulb.
details: Apply pressure continuously over a period of time and check whether it can be felt at the tip of speculum.

question: Perform preventive maintenance on Otoscope. Return device to clinical personnel.
details: Otoscope is working properly. Perform preventive maintenance before returning the device to clinical personnel.

question: Inspect and troubleshoot the otoscope for any cracks, physical damage.
details: Inspect otoscope for external cracks, damage, or dirt.
